body:
I made a quick little tutorial on how to make a very simple TNT trap.
It's not a very professional video, but I thought I might as well make it for fun. :)

Enjoy the video everyone!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OEXafLHVzTg

title: TnT Trap Tutorial!

replies.body: Quick question.. would you guys like more of these really simply tutorials?
replies.body_tagged: Quick question.. would you guys like more of these really simply tutorials?

replies.body: cool, but i'm gonna guess nobody would step on the pressure plate after seeing it..
replies.body_tagged: cool, but i'm gonna guess nobody would step on the pressure plate after seeing it..

replies.body: I made a variation of this in Walls once. But I used less TNT and wasn't able to kill the guy D:
replies.body_tagged: I made a variation of this in Walls once. But I used less TNT and wasn't able to kill the guy D:

replies.body: Nice, but as Spock said, I don't think people will see a pressure plate and step on it. Also, they could break the redstone, stack up, and escape.
replies.body_tagged: Nice, but as Spock said, I don't think people will see a pressure plate and step on it. Also, they could break the redstone, stack up, and escape.

replies.body: Sorry, but I don't understand why you keep spamming about your YT. You said you created a main thread about your YT, why don't you keep posting on it?
replies.body_tagged: Sorry, but I don't understand why you keep spamming about your YT. You said you created a main thread about your YT, why don't you keep posting on it?

replies.body: You do realize you can just break the redstone, place a block and then you're free?
replies.body_tagged: You do realize you can just break the redstone, place a block and then you're free?

replies.body:
That thread is just for my Nebula series.

@Robin I know it isn't very complicated, and the video was just for fun. This is was just a random tutorial but probably wouldn't be good to actually use in a situation where you want to build a trap.
